intro: Eschweileria gawadensis, commonly known as the Egyptian violet, is a species of flowering plant native to Egypt. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has simple, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy blooms during the spring and summer seasons. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in regions with similar climates.
